definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to nationalize/to take over as communal property

pinyin: gong1 shuo1 gong1 you3 li3 , po2 shuo1 po2 you3 li3
containing_words.word: 公說公有理，婆說婆有理

sentences.english: Non-public capital is allowed to enter the monopolized industries and fields.
sentences.chinese: 允許非公有資本進入壟斷行業和領域。

sentences.english: Study on Agricultural Socialized Service System in the Process of Building New Socialist Countrysides;
sentences.chinese: 社會化服務體系建設是發展非公有制林業的基本保障。

sentences.english: Non - public - owned organizations in China have achieved great development since the reform and opening up.
sentences.chinese: 改革開放以來，我國的非公有制經濟有了快速的發展。

sentences.english: This is again a case of privatizing the gains and socializing the losses;
sentences.chinese: 這是又一次的私有化收益，公有化損失。

sentences.english: Is non-public ownership compatible with socialism? the traditional answer is negative.
sentences.chinese: 非公有制經濟同社會主義相容嗎？

sentences.english: The people's government controlled the nation's economy and set up a state-owned socialist economy.
sentences.chinese: 人民政府控制經濟命脈並建立了公有制社會主義經濟。

sentences.english: Non-publicly-owned economic organization is an important part of our economy.
sentences.chinese: 非公有制經濟組織是我國經濟的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: We should strengthen the supervision and administration of the non-public sectors according to law to promote their sound development.
sentences.chinese: 依法加強監督和管理，促進非公有制經濟健康發展。

sentences.english: He insists the monument must be removed from public property.
sentences.chinese: 他堅決要求把紀念碑從公有地產上移走。

sentences.english: The first publicly owned museum in Europe was The Uffizi Gallery in Florence .
sentences.chinese: 第一公有博物館在歐洲的烏菲齊畫廊在佛羅倫薩。

sentences.english: The new government communized all banks.
sentences.chinese: 新政府正在使所有銀行公有化。

sentences.english: But today in the communistic society.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，公有制社會的今天。

sentences.english: Tertiary industry and private economies are growing rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 第三產業和非公有制經濟快速增長。

sentences.english: China′s entrance into WTO provides more opportunities to its non state owned economy.
sentences.chinese: 我國加入WTO爲非公有經濟發展提供了更多的機遇。

sentences.english: In China, the public has become a concern of the results.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，公有化已成爲人們存眷的一個成績。

sentences.english: They will certainly come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 他們肯定不公有好下場。

definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
public housing/dormitory, esp. for unmarried people
my late father/my ancestors/the late emperor
Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding/same as 太僕寺卿|太仆寺卿[Tai4 pu2 si4 qing1]
to rent out one's land (to tenant farmers)
to continue/to continue a family line/posterity/heir
